body_content.explanation: a line marked on a basketball court (= playing area) to show the place where a player must stand to take a free throw (= an opportunity to score extra points if a player from the other team has broken a rule):
examples: After she was fouled by the other team, she went to the free-throw line to take two shots.
He was shooting 85 percent (= was successful in making 85 percent of his shots) from the free throw line.
